intro: Lithospermum gmelinii, commonly known as the Siberian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinctive blue-green color. Lithospermum gmelinii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
